snippet: Mr. Trump, who attracts blue-collar voters by promising a 35 percent tariff, has pledged to be the Republican presidential candidate who brings industrial states back into the Republican fold.
abstract: Donald J Trump, as he prepares for Michigan primary, is looking beyond Republican nomination to general election in courting Midwest's blue-collar voters, who traditionally support Democrats; must depend on votes of working-class white men after alienating Hispanic voters with threats of deportation; demographic shifts since 'Reagan Democrat' era make strategy questionable.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Trump, who attracts blue-collar voters by promising a 35 percent tariff, has pledged to be the Republican presidential candidate who brings industrial states back into the Republican fold.

headline.main: Michigan Primary Puts Donald Trump’s Rust Belt Strategy to a Test
headline.print_headline: Pledging to Bring Back Jobs, Trump Tests Rust Belt Strategy in Michigan Primary
